title: PROJECT-01 — Momentum vs Mean-Reversion
summary: Builds and compares momentum and mean-reversion strategies, including parameter sweeps and walk-forward validation.
impact: Teaches students how signal design affects risk/return.

title: PROJECT-02 — Portfolio Optimization with Efficient Frontier
summary: Modern Portfolio Theory with mean–variance, risk parity, and constraints; plots efficient frontier and allocation.
impact: Shows how diversification shapes drawdowns and Sharpe.

title: PROJECT-03 — Pairs Trading Cointegration & Z-Score
summary: Tests pairs, checks cointegration, computes z-score signals, and evaluates hedged PnL.
impact: Explains market-neutral alpha with low beta exposure.

title: PROJECT-04 — Options Volatility
summary: Builds IV smile/surface, Greeks, and simple strategies (covered calls, protective puts).
impact: Connects implied volatility and payoff diagrams to risk management.

title: PROJECT-05 — ML for Markets
summary: Binary classification of returns with cross-validation, ROC/PR curves, and feature importance.
impact: Shows limits of prediction and the need for robust validation.

title: PROJECT-06 — Sharpe Ratio Optimization
summary: Computes portfolio statistics, maximizes Sharpe, and visualizes weights and equity curve.
impact: Explains objective functions and risk-adjusted return.

title: PROJECT-07 — Monte Carlo Option Pricing
summary: Simulates GBM paths, prices options via Monte Carlo, and studies convergence.
impact: Builds intuition for randomness and pricing accuracy.

title: PROJECT-08 — Value at Risk & Expected Shortfall
summary: Estimates VaR/ES using historical and parametric approaches; visualizes tails.
impact: Shows downside risk beyond standard deviation.

title: PROJECT-09 — CAPM Factor Models
summary: Runs CAPM regressions, estimates alpha/beta, and analyzes residuals.
impact: Links theory to realized factor exposures.

title: PROJECT-10 — Daily Returns & Volatility
summary: Computes daily/rolling returns, volatility, and autocorrelation; plots stylized facts.
impact: Introduces clustering and memory in returns.
